image.altText: A baby wearing a hair tie smiles while playing with toys in a living room

props.synopsis: An inquest will consider how a manipulative father was able to take his life and that of his baby daughter on the same day he was allowed access to her.

title.children: Man who killed baby daughter at Whispering Wall breached non-contact order 149 times

image.altText: woman looking through fence

props.synopsis: This global religious sect has restrictions around television, eating with others and attending university. Its members also run schools and a charity that have received millions of dollars in funding from taxpayers.

title.children: Former Brethren members speak out about life in a religious sect

image.altText: A close up view of a smoke stack at the Whyalla steelworks, taken at sunset

props.synopsis: The company says it will use some of the funds to fix the Whyalla steelwork's blast furnace which has been offline since August.

title.children: GFG Alliance secures $150 million loan to pay staff and fund repairs

image.altText: Screenshot of three police officers outside a house next to an aircon unit and a person on the ground

props.synopsis: Footage of a man being shoved into a wall by a police officer before being dragged through a front yard has been shared on social media, with SA Police confirming a formal complaint has been made about the incident.

title.children: 'Confronting' footage of man being shoved into a wall by police officer part of formal complaint

image.altText: Radio host David Bevan on air.

props.synopsis: Renowned, esteemed and much-loved ABC Radio Adelaide presenter David Bevan has announced his retirement after more than 20 years on the airwaves.

title.children: 'You've ruined my eye make-up': David Bevan's retirement prompts tributes and tears from listeners

image.altText: A sandy bay with a small jetty and swimming pontoon

props.synopsis: Port Elliot's swimming pontoon has been loved by local swimmers, surf clubs and tourists for over a decade, but the council says it could cost $186,000 annually to reinstall it after it washed up on the beach during a storm.

title.children: Council seeks 'low cost' options to get swimming pontoon back in the water after $180k insurance shock

image.altText: Elderly woman sits on her bed longingly holding an old black and white photo of her younger self next to her late husband.

props.synopsis: When Shirley met the love of her life at age 19, Australian society didn't allow her and her soulmate to be together.

title.children: The enduring love story that defied the White Australia policy

image.altText: Vincent Tarzia and Amanda Wilson.

props.synopsis: SA Liberal leader Vincent Tarzia says his party will not re-visit the late-term abortion debate following its by-election loss in Black, warning anyone who introduces a private member's bill on the topic "won't be welcome in the shadow cabinet or in the cabinet".

title.children: SA Liberal leader issues warning to party following by-election defeat, says abortion debate is 'over'

image.altText: Montrezl Harrell of the Adelaide 36ers fights with Melbourne United players

props.synopsis: The NBL is investigating a confrontation between players and fans during Sunday's game between Melbourne United and the Adelaide 36ers, as Nick Kyrgios throws his hat into the ring, backing 36er Montrezl Harrell.

title.children: NBL investigates after Melbourne United and Adelaide 36ers melee spills over sidelines and leads to fan evictions

image.altText: A smiling man in police uniform leans against a police car outside a police station

props.synopsis: A year on, the town of Lucindale is still grieving the death of their local cop, volunteer and friend. Brevet Sergeant Jason Doig was fatally shot while attending a rural property in South Australia 12 months ago.

title.children: 'The community was his family': Cricket match held to remember cop who died in the line of duty

image.altText: A young teenage footballer holding the ball on field

props.synopsis: Angus Clarke spent this past winter making an eight-hour round trip twice a week to play his beloved footy. He's one of many regional young footballers sacrificing time and money to get noticed and will soon find out whether his efforts will be rewarded with an AFL draft pick.

title.children: For teenage AFL draft prospects, the big league is often the reward for going the extra mile

image.altText: a young boy standing on a golf course with a bag of golf clubs and a putting flag over his shoulder

props.synopsis: Young people across the country are increasingly taking up golf with the intent to pursue it into the future — a phenomenon a PGA professional in South Australia did not see coming.

title.children: Young golfers tee up to grow the sport that's not just for retirees

image.altText: A group of people march through a city street

props.synopsis: A proposed bill that won't become law has become a flashpoint on race relations at a critical moment in the fraught 180-year-old conversation about how New Zealand should honour the promises made to First Nations people.

title.children: A small party inside New Zealand's ruling coalition has ignited a nationwide protest

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: The crown prosecution in a manslaughter trial says no-one was at risk of injury from a great-grandmother who died after being tasered by a police officer, but the defence says it was the accused's "job to obtain a resolution".

title.children: Jury hears police officer who tasered a 95yo woman was 'fed up, impatient, not prepared to wait any longer'

image.altText: Woolworths

props.synopsis: Woolworths faced scrutiny at the ACCC's inquiry regarding its treatment of fruit and vegetable suppliers. Meanwhile, the ASX reached another intra-day record high. Catch up on the day's events and insights from ABC News' markets blog.

title.children: Woolworths refuses to answer ACCC's questions on bargaining power, Tesla rallies, ASX hits another intra-day record high — as it happened

image.altText: People holding up alcoholic cocktails

props.synopsis: Two Australian teenagers are fighting for their lives in Thai hospitals after consuming drinks suspected to contain methanol in Laos.

title.children: What is methanol poisoning and how can I protect myself?

image.altText: An aerial image of bushland with the faces of Greg Lynn, Carol Clay and Russell Hill on top.

props.synopsis: The former Jetstar pilot has formally lodged an appeal to try to overturn the jury's verdict and judge's sentence over the death of Victorian camper Carol Clay.

title.children: Greg Lynn lodges appeal against his murder conviction and sentence over Carol Clay's death

image.altText: a man in a suit standing, and looking on, surrounded by bright lights

props.synopsis: Among all Donald Trump's cabinet picks, Matt Gaetz looms as the most divisive. Even some Republicans are preparing to vote against the nomination — and flushing them out might be the president-elect's aim.

title.children: Trump's pick for attorney-general has been described as 'worst in American history'

image.altText: A student at Charles Darwin University heads to a 2016 graduation ceremony.

props.synopsis: The Greens are pushing for a Labor policy on HECS relief that had been planned for after the election to be included in the indexation bill being debated now.

title.children: Labor's plan to undo HECS debt indexation uncertain after Greens amendment — as it happened

image.altText: Woman in wheelchair at graduation ceremony

props.synopsis: Jade McAlear sustained multiple fractures and was in a coma in Royal Melbourne Hospital for four months. She is now living with an acquired brain injury (ABI).

title.children: Jade lives with acquired brain injury and wants people to stop treating her like a child

image.altText: The Taj Mahal is obscured by smog in India.

props.synopsis: Measures to curb pollution such as installing more pollution monitors and pushing for a switch to cleaner fuels are yet to yield significant results.

title.children: 'It's an apocalypse': Smog in India, Pakistan up to 60 times safe level spurs calls for action

image.altText: Flames coming out of the ground with a fire fighter in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Israel has intensified its bombardment in and around the Lebanese capital over the last week, and Hezbollah has kept up missile fire into Israel, even as US-led diplomacy to halt the fighting has progressed.

title.children: Lebanon, Hezbollah agree to US proposal for ceasefire with Israel

image.altText: Sam Kerr of the Matildas signs the shirt of her partner Kristie Mewis after a match

props.synopsis: Matildas captain Sam Kerr target of homophobic abuse after revealing she is having a baby with her fiancee Kristie Mewis.

title.children: Sam Kerr subjected to homophobic abuse after announcing first child with partner Kristie Mewis

image.altText: An old man wearing glasses and a suit holds up one hand while speaking

props.synopsis: Canadian authorities thwart an alleged Iranian plot to assassinate Irwin Cotler, a former justice minister who has been a strong critic of Tehran.

title.children: Pro-Israeli former Canadian politician targeted in alleged Iranian assassination plot

image.altText: A woman stands in a garden, looking into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: The scandal threatening to engulf Australia's superannuation industry has spread to another major operator, Australian Ethical, which has apologised for taking almost a year to process a widow's application to access her dead husband's retirement savings.

title.children: Superannuation crisis spreads to sustainable-branded fund Australian Ethical

image.altText: Old man and young woman sitting on a sofa playing cards

props.synopsis: Like a good wine, the boomers are getting richer with age. But it's coming at the expense of young people, and one day they might just pull the cork out.

title.children: The Boomers may be getting richer with age, but things could turn sour at any moment

image.altText: A man and a woman lean in as if they are about to kiss.

props.synopsis: Jessica Chastain and Peter Sarsgaard star as two damaged people both struggling with the past, their family and things outside of their control. In Memory, they find a strange solace in each other.

title.children: Jessica Chastain and Peter Sarsgaard stun in this tender, unorthodox film about the pitfalls of memory

image.altText: An elderly woman walks with her head high flanked by a man in his 50s looking tired, both wearing black coats

props.synopsis: The children of Dominique Pelicot, who is on trial for orchestrating men to join him in drugging and raping his wife over a decade, tell of their shock and grief during his trial in a French court.

title.children: Gisele Pelicot's children speak of 'trial of entire family' as daughter alleges she was also abused

image.altText: Beau Lamarre in a police uniform

props.synopsis: Lawyers for former Sydney police officer Beau Lamarre-Condon, who is charged with murdering Jesse Baird and Luke Davies, ask for a nearly three month delay to his case.

title.children: Fifty-page document handed to court as double murder case against former police officer delayed for 12 weeks

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A Canberra woman who alleges she was sexually assaulted after a work Christmas party tells the court she felt embarrassed and like an idiot for offering a drunk colleague a lift home so he'd be safe.

title.children: Canberra public servant allegedly sexually assaulted woman as she gave him lift home from work party

image.altText: A young woman with brown hair wearing a white dress stands in front of a bright cafe looking at the camera

props.synopsis: More than 6 million people have been forced to leave Ukraine since Russia launched its illegal invasion in 2022, but some people have built new lives elsewhere while remaining determined to one day rebuild their homeland.

title.children: Russia's invasion of Ukraine forced 6 million refugees to seek a new life elsewhere

image.altText: A woman shears a sheep as two men watch.

props.synopsis: The 37-year-old mother-of-four managed a running average of 72.3 seconds per lamb to secure a place in the shearing record books.

title.children: Yass woman shears 395 merino lambs in 8 hours, setting world record

image.altText: Bee Gees tribute band Best of the Bee Gees announced Colin Petersen's passing with "heavy hearts".

props.synopsis: His death was announced by tribute band The Best of the Bee Gees, who he toured with extensively over the past five years.

title.children: Original Bee Gees drummer Colin 'Smiley' Petersen dies at 78

image.altText: Cassandra Barratt and Archie 1

props.synopsis: The gender pay gap — the difference in average pay between Australian men and women — is 11.5 per cent, which is the equivalent of working from November 19 until the end of they year without being paid for it.

title.children: Gender pay gap means 'today is the day that women effectively start working for free'
